thread.title: Devon wants final say on Brexit deal say campaign group

author: Lewis Clarke
title: Devon wants final say on Brexit deal say campaign group
text:
Devon wants final say on Brexit deal say campaign group A survey was carried out using coloured balls in Exeter Share The UK voted to leave in a referendum Share Get Daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Devon residents have overwhelmingly called for a final say in Brexit, a campaign group have claimed. 
In a poll of those visiting the Devon for Europe stall in Exeter, before, during and after the March for Europe on March 24, the group are saying an overwhelming number indicated that they felt the people should have the final say when the Brexit deal negotiations are complete and the terms are known. Read More Meet the young Devon activists who are fighting Brexit 
Using coloured balls to vote on: “Who should get the final say on the Brexit deal?” an overwhelming majority of people chose the “We Should" option. 
Alex Pilkington, Chair of Devon for Europe, said: “The Brexit deal promised by the Leave campaign is undeliverable. 
“Whichever way people voted in the referendum, they have the democratic right to reject a deal which will make the whole country poorer. The best deal available is the one we already have as members of the EU and that fact is becoming obvious to more and more people." Like us on Facebook
